dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/572899284 at Fri May 29 10:21:40 UTC 2020

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})

avg by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w
)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="nfs"} offset 1w
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
    ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: nfs_service Component Error Rates

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.span:
This resource measures average CPU across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Disk sustained read IOPS saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_read_iops{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="disk_sustained_read_iops"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Read IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk sustained read throughput saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_read_bytes_seconds{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="disk_sustained_read_throughput"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Read Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write IOPS value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_write_iops{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="disk_sustained_write_iops"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Write IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write throughput value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_write_bytes_seconds{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="disk_sustained_write_throughput"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Write Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
This resource measures average CPU across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU per Shard

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="nfs", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="nfs",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph stor
  nfs
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage"}),
  1
)

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage"}[$__range]))
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage"})
